title: Component Options
description: Learn how to migrate from Nuxt 2 components options to Nuxt 3 composables.

children.value: to fetch your data - or just the polyfilled global
In Nuxt 3 you can use a globally available
method that has the same API as
. It has a number of benefits, including:
if it's running on the server, or making a client-side call to your API if it's running on the client. (It can also handle calling third-party APIs.)
Plus, it comes with convenience features including automatically parsing responses and stringifying data.
Nuxt 3 provides new composables for fetching data:
), which do not block client-side navigation.
In Nuxt 2, you'd fetch your data in your component using a syntax similar to:

children.value: Within your methods and templates, you could use the
variable similar how you'd use any other piece of data provided by your component.
With Nuxt 3, you can perform this data fetching using composables in your

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
// Define params wherever, through `defineProps()`, `useRoute()`, etc.
const { data: post, refresh } = await useAsyncData('post', () => $fetch(`https://api.nuxtjs.dev/posts/${params.id}`) )
// Or instead - useFetch is a convenience wrapper around useAsyncData when you're just performing a simple fetch
const { data: post, refresh } = await useFetch(`https://api.nuxtjs.dev/posts/${params.id}`)
</script>

children.value: The validate hook in Nuxt 3 only accepts a single argument, the
. Just as in Nuxt 2, you can return a boolean value. If you return false and another match can't be found, this will mean a 404. You can also directly return an object with
to respond immediately with an error (other matches will not be checked).

props.className: language-diff shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: This is not supported in Nuxt 3. Instead, you can directly use a watcher to trigger refetching data.

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
const route = useRoute()
const { data, refresh } = await useFetch('/api/user')
watch(() => route.query, () => refresh())
</script>
